title.rendered: “IDF Strikes Terrorists Hiding in UNRWA School: Aerial Assaults and Civilian Safety Measures”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

The IDF attacked terrorists operating in a UNRWA school in the Nur Shams area.

Air Force fighter jets attacked a short while ago, under the direction of military intelligence, the Shin Bet, and the Southern Command, terrorists operating from the “An-Nazareth” school of UNRWA in the Nur Shams area.

The terrorists used the school to plan and execute terror plots against our forces currently operating in the Strip.

Prior to the attack, numerous measures were taken to minimize the risk of civilian casualties, including thorough aerial reconnaissance, the use of precise munitions, and additional intelligence information.

The terrorist organization Hamas routinely violates international law by systematically exploiting civilian structures and the civilian population as human shields for terrorist operations against the State of Israel.

Additionally, Air Force aircraft recently targeted a company commander in the maritime force of the terrorist organization PIJ in western Khan Younis. Reports are being verified that several civilians were harmed as a result of the attack; details are under investigation.
